Description: Shallow black-glazed pottery dish, with slightly splayed ring foot. Wholly glazed save for stand-ring and underside which has one broad and two thin black bands. Graffito under foot?
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Brooklyn Museum, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Reportedly from Abydos, but possibly collected at Naukratis
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1771)
Condition: Complete but slip badly rubbed and flaked
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Brooklyn Museum, New York
